meanings.sent1: The tired man felt proud after his travailed day at the farm.
meanings.sent2: She admired the travailed hands of the carpenter, showing his dedication.
meanings.sent3: The little ant travailed diligently to carry the heavy crumb to its nest.
meanings.sent4: Her travailed expression revealed the effort she put into the project.
meanings.sent5: The old tree bore the marks of many travailed seasons, standing tall and strong.

meanings.definition: Underwent intense physical or mental effort
meanings.sent1: After he travailed through the difficult exam, he felt relieved.
meanings.sent2: The hiker travailed up the steep mountain, feeling exhausted but accomplished.
meanings.sent3: The cat travailed to catch the elusive mouse, but it always slipped away.
meanings.sent4: She travailed through the emotional turmoil, coming out stronger on the other side.
meanings.sent5: The determined athlete travailed through the grueling race, crossing the finish line with a smile.

meanings.definition: Journeyed or traveled, especially over a long distance
meanings.sent1: The family travailed across the country to visit relatives during the holidays.
meanings.sent2: She travailed to the remote village, eager to experience its unique culture.
meanings.sent3: The brave explorer travailed through the dense jungle, discovering new species along the way.
meanings.sent4: The merchant travailed along the ancient trade route, trading goods with distant lands.
meanings.sent5: The pilgrims travailed to the sacred shrine, seeking blessings for their journey ahead.
